Seymour Krelborn.Action: Climbing a tall and dangerous ladder made of crates, boxes, and books to put something away on a high shelf.
Loses balance and falls along with various items in a clumsy accident, causing a crash.
Pops back up and responds verbally with some confidence after falling.
Maintains a living space underground with numerous exotic plants flourishing in makeshift containers under improvised grow lights.
Tends to a dying plant with great care
Looks out the window with longing upon hearing the sound of high heels
Notices a dying plant, carefully repots it, and places it under a gro-light with great care.
Shows hopeful, attentive behavior by looking out the basement window at the sound of heels, indicating alertness and emotional engagement.
Attempts to help unload clay pots for Mr. Mushnik despite physical clumsiness.
Greets Audrey warmly and compliments her appearance sincerely even while fallen on the floor.

Attempts to carry a precarious pile of clay pots for Mushnik, showing willingness to help.
Loses footing and drops the pots with an ear-splitting crash, damaging inventory.
Greets Audrey politely and compliments her despite being on the floor, showing social awareness.
Sings about being poor and mistreated but continues to work diligently sweeping the shop floor.
Expresses feelings of hopelessness and a desire to escape his harsh environment.
Sweeps the shop floor obediently despite feeling unappreciated and poor, showing persistence in his menial task.
Expresses confusion and lack of clear purpose in life, asking God what he's for and receiving no confident answer.
Accepts poor treatment from Mushnik and his social position as a slob without resistance, indicating low self-confidence and passivity.
Continuously prays and wishes for a chance to improve his life, revealing hope and persistence despite adversity.
Sings with others, expressing feelings of being trapped and desire to escape
Backs away from menacing bums singing to him, showing fear but no aggression

Expresses a strong desire and motivation to escape Skid Row and improve his life, showing determination despite feeling trapped.
Suggests a new approach to save the failing shop to Mr. Mushnik.
Obediently and helpfully fetches the unusual plant when asked.
Describes the withered plant honestly, even though it looks bad.
Suggests moving the business in a new direction by promoting unusual plants to attract customers.
Brings up a withered, unhealthy plant that appears worse than before to show Mushnik and Audrey.
Admits he has not been able to identify the plant in any reference books and gives it his own name.
Names the plant Audrey Two as a tribute to Audrey, indicating affection and thoughtfulness.
Explains and shares enthusiasm about the plant with a customer, showing openness and friendliness.
Hesitates and seems uncertain when responding to Mushnik's criticism, indicating insecurity but not hostility.
Identifies the unusual plant and gives it a name 'Audrey Two' despite not finding it in books.
Attempts to use the plant as a way to attract customers by placing it in the window and explaining its uniqueness.
Seems unsure or lacks full knowledge about the plant's origin or nature.

Decides not to buy the plant despite interest, showing restraint and respect for circumstances.

Examines an unusual plant offered by the Mandarin with interest and decides to not buy it after consideration.
Stops abruptly when noticing something unusual in the sky (the eclipse), showing awareness and attention to detail.
Passively accepts the strange plant appearing among the flowers without initial suspicion or proactive questioning about it.
Pays the old Chinese man a dollar ninety-five for the strange plant without complaint.
Exchanges a look of mutual disappointment with Mushnik and Audrey regarding the lack of customers, showing shared empathy and connection.
Silent, no boastfulness or greed shown despite the customer offering a large amount of money for roses.
Pays $1.95 for an unusual plant from a mysterious seller despite uncertainty.
Carries the new plant confidently away from the seller into the shop.
Exchanges a look of mutual disappointment with Mushnik and Audrey over the customer leaving, indicating awareness of the situation.
Reacting with surprise and curiosity at the customer's decision to buy more flowers, showing engagement but tentative understanding.

Is excited about the plant's success and sales but defers to Mushnik and Audrey rather than taking charge.

Attempts to care for the wilting plant despite not knowing its breed or genus and finding no help in books.
Expresses forlorn feelings and fails to immediately take effective action to save the plant.
Gazes at Audrey with painful longing while tending to his plant, showing care and devotion.
Sings an intimate, earnest song expressing hope and tenderness toward his plant despite repeated failures.
Tries multiple methods to care for his plant, demonstrating persistence and sincere nurturing.

Despite his efforts and use of resources, the plant remains unhealthy and unresponsive, showing a lack of effective results from his actions.
Gives up temporarily on the plant's progress and starts putting his room in order, showing a pause in persistence.
Carefully tends to the plant using gardening techniques and supplements, showing patience and care.
Sings to the plant and offers his own blood despite feeling queasy, showing willingness to sacrifice for something he cares about.
Tries to trick the plant by hiding his blood to test its behavior, indicating curiosity and cautiousness rather than mistrust.

Systematically tries different plant care techniques (southern exposure, pinching back, grow-lights, mineral supplements) indicating persistence and effort.
Notices the odd behavior of the plant’s shadow and the pod opening, indicating observational skill.
Shrugs off initial puzzlement and returns to other tasks rather than immediately investigating plant behavior.

Moves finger fast to trick the plant to open and close, demonstrating quick reflexes and cleverness.
Shows hesitation and mild disgust at bleeding into the plant, but decides the risk is acceptable and rationalizes it.
Despite signs of danger and unnatural behavior, he downplays consequences and proceeds, potentially indicating naivety or lack of caution.

Waits patiently and sits calmly with Audrey Two on his lap alongside other unusual companions, showing tolerance and acceptance.

Notices the plant about to bite the engineer and intervenes to stop it.

Allows Audrey to come to the shop and interact despite her injuries, showing tolerance and friendliness.

Has a large picture of himself and the plant displayed prominently in the shop window, indicating some recognition or achievement.
Appears on television holding Audrey Two and winning horticultural awards, showing recognition for his plant-related skills and public confidence.
Portrayed as previously down-and-out, 'shnook', 'bringin' up the rear', illustrating a prior lack of success or confidence.
Appears on a television show holding an increasingly large Audrey Two and talks to knowledgeable people, showing his involvement and interaction in a public setting.

Admits to feeling weak and lightheaded and acknowledges his forgetfulness humbly.

Admiring the glittering arrangement, showing attention to detail and appreciation for beauty.
